pullRequest.title: Update coroutines example to be the new newsreader example
pullRequest.bodyText:
Updated coroutines example to be the new newsreader example. All data is accessed and consumed asynchronously using Kotlin Flows.

The main view is a recyclerview with a pull-to-refresh mechanism and a dropdown spinner to select a section.
Stories are valid for 30 minutes. After said period the next load will refresh the current section.
The details view is just a few textviews. A news story will be marked as "read" after 2 seconds in the details view.
Views are inflated using Android DataBinding and UI updates are handled via LiveData.
Individual stories for the details view are fetched directly from Realm and not Store since we already have them in disk.
The project uses Dropbox Store (https://github.com/dropbox/Store) for fetching/accessing the stories from the main view.
Fetching data from the NYT API is done using Retrofit.
A custom FlowFactory is showcased due to Store's logic when processing results in its data reader. Store does not consider an empty list as no results (toFlow and asFlowable usually emit an empty RealmResults list when calling findAllAsync), therefore it will treat it as "results not found", triggering the API fetcher and therefore rendering the repository useless. In this custom flow factory implementation the current results/objects are not emitted right away, which does not confuse Store into thinking it has to refresh data from the API.
There are data models for network and domain layers. Realm models are used as domain objects.

commit.message: Enabled viewbinding
Polished example: added databinding and listen to db changes from the UI
wip - adapted example to using store
Made DAO thread-safe for opening/closing realm instances in suspend functions. Updated OS pointer.
Added recyclerview and monothreaded dispatcher
Rearranged package structure, improved event handling and cleanup
Added newsreader functionality
Functional news list
Added a Room DAO to concept-proof the solution but still doesn't work
Simplified logic for loading sections, now we always refresh
Removed old dog-related stuff
Separated realm and room implementations with an awful lot of code repetition
wip
Cleanup and finally grokked how to use Store
Merge branch 'master' into el/store-coroutines-example
Removed alternative implementation
wip
First steps towards having a coroutines factory
Hid Kotlin dependencies from artifact, only for compile time
Added dependencies for testing, added missing toFlow methods and tests for config and syncconfig
Corrected signatures
Added missing realm instance flow methods to factory and tests

Made realm property in RealmResults and RealmList public so that it can be accessed from extension functions (the existing getRealm method cannot be used for DynamicRealms so that would break the API), added missing flow methods for dynamic realms and tests, and added docs and beta annotations to factory methods
Added missing documentation and renamed builder method to flowFactory instead
Added support for Flows with no results when using findFirst
Added exclusion of Kotlin files for javadoc generation
Added test for null object to flow
Added missing collect to trigger thread violation
Merge branch 'el/coroutines-factory' into el/store-coroutines-example
Fixed test factories
Merge branch 'el/coroutines-factory' into el/store-coroutines-example
Cleanup. Added 30 min expiration time in between network requests
Added check for null rx and flow factories in config builder, added check for flows present in classpath, added missing null factory checks, added missing docs and cleaned up a bit
Created internal factory in Kotlin and left the default implementation in Java to avoid issues with javadoc, plus added invalid object tests

Removed conceptually-wrong test, it passed before due not having added the awaitClose to the callbackFlow blocks when invalid results/objects are detected (which was the case, as the realm instance had been closed right before starting collection of the flow for the second time)
Added changeset methods and tests
Added final missing tests plus renamed two wrongly-named ones
Merge branch 'el/coroutines-factory' into el/store-coroutines-example
Added missing methods in test factory
Merge branch 'el/coroutines-factory' into el/store-coroutines-example
wip towards adding a details screen
Added missing methods in test factory
Merge branch 'el/coroutines-factory' into el/store-coroutines-example
Fixed wrong parsing with moshi and added details screen
Changed check for a closed realm instead of invalid object since findFirstAsync always returns "invalid object" right away, so we can't use isValid
Merge branch 'el/coroutines-factory' into el/store-coroutines-example
Cleanup
Added api key interceptor
More cleanup
Cleanup
Layout cleanup

Merge branch 'master' into el/store-coroutines-example

+import kotlin.time.ExperimentalTime
+import kotlin.time.seconds
+
+@ExperimentalTime
+class DetailsViewModel : ViewModel() {
+
+    private val repository = DependencyGraph.provideNewsReaderRepository()
+
+    private val article = MutableLiveData<RealmNYTimesArticle>()
+
+    private val _read = MutableLiveData<Boolean>()
+    val read: LiveData<Boolean>
+        get() = _read
+
+    val date = article.map { it.updatedDate.toString() }
+    val title = article.map { it.title }
+    val articleText = article.map { it.abstractText }
+
+    override fun onCleared() {
+        repository.close()
+    }
+
+    fun loadDetails(id: String) {
+        repository.getStory(id)
+                .onEach { realmArticle ->
+                    checkNotNull(realmArticle)
+                            .also {
+                                if (article.value == null) {
+                                    article.postValue(it)
+
+                                    if (!it.read) {
+                                        markAsRead(it)
+                                    } else {
+                                        markAsRead(it, true)
+                                    }
+                                }
+                            }
+                }.launchIn(viewModelScope)
+    }
+
+    private fun markAsRead(article: RealmNYTimesArticle, immediately: Boolean = false) {

+            _read.postValue(true)
+        } else {
+            flow<Unit> {
+                delay(2.seconds)
+                if (currentCoroutineContext().isActive) {

nodes.bodyText: Any reason we need both ErrorException and ErrorMessage as states? Doesn't that just complicate things since we are just reading the error message from the exception anyway?

Wouldn't a much cleaner solution be to just call the super methods and then drop or filter out the first element emitted?
Copying the entire internal implementation seems very error-prone in terms of maintaining it?

commit.message: Updated OS pointer to master's
Removed old newsreader example, updated Store library dependency, cleaned up flow factory, added documentation, removed unnecessary coroutine context check
